events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car at an intersection and submitted the initial claim form with incident details.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the vehicle collision described in the report.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to the case to ensure quick handling of the auto accident claim.
The claim was acknowledged formally, and the customer was informed of the next steps in the evaluation process.
The agent requested additional documents including police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates from the customer.
Customer submitted all requested documents timely, including the official accident report and vehicle damage photos.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and statements related to the car accident claim.
Investigation concluded confirming that the customer was not at fault and the damage assessment was consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement amount covering all the vehicle repairs and associated costs was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer responded with positive feedback appreciating the timely communication and fair settlement offer.
The claim approval was finalized by the claims supervisor after verifying all required conditions were fulfilled successfully.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the customer and confirmed through bank transfer notification.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment issuance and follow-up confirming customer satisfaction.
All documentation and case files related to the vehicle collision claim were archived according to regulatory standards.
